h6. Steps to replicate
# create a space
# Create a page named "Meeting notes" inside that space
# On this page at the "Create from templates" Macro with the following settings:
#* Button text: Create meeting note
#* Template name: Meeting notes
# Save the page
# Click the button "Creating meeting note" and save the page


h6. Observed Behavior
Another page with the name "Meeting notes (2)" is generated

h6. Expected Behavior
Doesn't create a new index page because it should have recognizes that there is already a page called "Meeting notes" or a warning stating that there is aalready page name with meeting notes.
fields.summary: Create template macro create duplicates page

fields.description:
*Steps To replicate*
# Open Internet internet explorer
# Create a page
# Add the following sentences in the page:
{code}
I would like to add inline comment.
{code}
# Highlight the word "Add inline comment" and add a comment
# After that refresh the page and resolved the comment you added
# Refresh the page and try to add inline comment for the same word.


h6. Observed Behavior
We unable to add the inline comment for the same word.

h6. Expected Behavior
We should be able to add a comment again for the same word

*Workaround*
Use other browser. e.g Mozilla firefox and Google chrome
fields.summary: Unable to create inline comment in Internet Explorer

fields.description:
This results in comments for attachments showing up in global search and the dashboard, even though the page they're attached to is no longer reachable.

AbstractPage.getSearchableDependants needs to be updated to include these sorts of content objects.
fields.summary: Trashing page does not trash comments on attachments

fields.description:
When a page is trashed, we remove all entries from the main index and the change index for the page and all dependent objects (comments, attachments, etc). This is so that the trashed content doesn't show up site search (which uses the main index) or the dashboard (which uses the change index).

However, when we restore a page from the trash, we don't restore all the change index entries. This means that attachments and comments on the restored page won't show up on the dashboard when they should, making it significantly harder to see the content after it is restored.
fields.summary: Restoring page from trash does not restore change index for dependents

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36464].
  {panel}

At All People view, open and edit a version of the duplicate, say adding a photo, after save, both record will have the updated photo displayed.

How to clean-up/remove the duplicate?

Note, if at a Confluence document, manage Watchers, typing in the person (with the duplicated record), both duplicates will appear but only one with the updated photo.

At Site Administration > User Management, can only see one reference to the person.

Apparently, the user was created by system administrator.  Later, the user created himself upon the login Confluence process, and specified the same email address.

Hope the information helps.

Many thanks.
Frankey

h3. Steps to reproduce: # Create a table in 3x3 in Excel or Open Office Calc # Copy this table. # Paste into a Confluence page. # You'll see that there isn't an option to sort the tables there. h3. Workaround: * create a new table from scratch * copy all cells of the faulty table (which was most likely just pasted from MS Office to the Confluence page) by clicking first in the first (top left) cell, then shift-clicking in the last (bottom right) cell and copying the whole (CTRL-C or contextual menu) * paste the clipboard into the first cell of the newly created table * delete the "old" table * save the page h3. Source Editor: # The first table is pasted from Excel, the second one was created via workaround: {code}
Number Customer
1 Atlassian.com
2 Bodybuilding.com
3 Youtube.com
Number Customer
1 Atlassian.com
2 Bodybuilding.com
3 Youtube.com
{code}

fields.description:
Dear Sir or Madame,

we are currently facing an issue with an unnecessary horizontal scrollbar on almost every page. This happens since our last upgrade of Confluence.
The issue occurs as soon as the page layout gets changed from a 100% layout to something like a 50/50 (or any other) split. If the layout gets changed back, the scrollbar disappears. 
This is considered unnecessary as the page would display just fine without the scrollbar.

We already searched the knowledge base and found a similar issue in an old version. See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31653 

We already tested this with the latest versions of IE, FF and Chrome and it appears to be not a browser issue.

We already tried to solve this with updating to the latest patch of Confluence but the issue still persists.

Could you please help us with this?

Thanks
Best Regards
Gürkan
fields.summary: Unnecessary horizontal scrollbar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36445].
  {panel}

I was thinking it would be really cool if you guys added CQL. Essentially a query language that returns pages or attributes from pages that meet certain criteria.

You could match on labels, creation time, space, attachments, whether it has children, etc.


You could match on some of the attributes here:
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/javadoc/confluence/latest/reference/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/Page.html


I ran into the need when I wanted to include all of the pages of the children of a parent. However there were so many it would be very tedious to do so with page includes. I started writing a macro for it, but I don't think we should need to make our own macros to do something so simple. 


Even that however was a workaround for what I really needed.

What I really needed was to include the content of all children of a certain parents who matched a certain creation date.
fields.summary: CQL return pages or content, etc, that match certain criteria

fields.description:
When creating an SMTP Server in Confluence, you may find that upon submission you are presented with a HTTP 400 error, stating that "The request sent by the client was syntactically incorrect".

The cause for this problem is unknown at this time. We've seen this problem affecting Google Chrome Version 40.0.2214.95 (64-bit), but we have not been able to reproduce it.

h5.Workaround
Use an alternative web browser such as Mozilla Firefox to create the Mail Server.

If you run into this problem, please get in touch with [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/] - we'd be very keen in determine the root cause of this issue.
fields.summary: Creating an SMTP server results in HTTP Error 400 - The request sent by the client was syntactically incorrect

fields.description:
This is an umbrella issue to investigate why the Confluence upgrade to 5.7 takes a long amount of time with certain database configurations or in some rare cases even hangs.

Here is an example log message:
{code}
2015-02-05 01:35:26,704 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [upgrade.upgradetask.attachmentceo.AttachmentIdClashResolver] resolveAttachmentIdClashes No ID collisions were found between the ATTACHMENTS and CONTENT tables.
2015-02-05 01:35:26,717 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [upgrade.upgradetask.attachmentceo.AttachmentToContentMigrator] doMigration Beginning migration of 6644 attachment entries..
{code}

This appears to be affecting SQL Server and Oracle databases that already have latency issues.

h2. Workaround for SQL Server
* SQL Server is known to have this issue when a connection validation query is enabled or when C3P0 (direct JDBC) connection pooling is used.
* There is a bug (CONF-36484) where the preferredTestQuery passed to C3P0 is ignored causing it to issue a "list tables" query which locks up if run while the upgrade task is running.
* The solution is to [switch to using a datasource connection|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-a-sql-server-datasource-in-apache-tomcat-218269283.html] with "select 1" as the connection test query.
fields.summary: On certain configurations, the attachments upgrade task very slow or hangs when upgrading to 5.7

fields.description:
h5.Environment
Confluence 5.6.5

h5.Directory Structure:
* Base DN: DC=corp,DC=local
* Location of Groups: OU=Confluence,DC=corp,DC=local
** Groups include {{confluence-users}} and {{confluence-administrators}}, among others
* Users are members of groups at that location

h5.Steps to Reproduce
* Configure a connection to Active Directory, with {{DC=corp,DC=local}} as your base DN
* Set {{OU=Confluence}} as your Additional Group DN
* Save and Synchronise Confluence 

h5.Expected Result
* All users will be synchronised in
* Memberships from Active Directory will be preserved - if a user is a member of {{confluence-users}} in Active Directory, that user should be a member of {{confluence-users}} in Confluence.

h5.Actual Result
* All users will be synchronised in
* Memberships from Active Directory will not be present - users sync'd in will not be members of specific groups.

h5.Possible Workaround
Performing a test as a particular user will force the memberships for that user to be synchronised in.

h5.Workaround:
Remove the additional Group DN from the configuration, and synchronise Confluence against the directory - memberships will be preserved.

Note: You can use [LDAP Filters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEV/How+to+Write+LDAP+Search+Filters] to ensure only the correct users and groups are brought into Confluence
fields.summary: Specifying an Additional Group DN causes memberships to be ignored in Active Directory

How to reproduce the error: 
1) Open Jira issue 
2) Choose More -> Link 
3) Choose Confluence Page -> search for a page 
4) Enter Confluence Page title where you want to link Jira issue 
5) Click button Link 
6) Open Confluence Page where you linked Jira issue 
8) Click "JIRA links" on the top of the page 
9) Empty dialog is opened as you can see in opacity_value_zero.png 

Expected behaviour: 
9) Dialog is opened as you can see in opacity_value_one.png 

Expected behaviour was achieved by editing opacity value from 0 to 1 in jira-metadata-dialog. Please check also console.png for details.
fields.summary: jira-metadata-dialog uses incorrect opacity value

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36415].
{panel}
h3. Issue summary

Cannot add inline comment to a string or substring which is similar to link (into another Confluence page).
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # In a space, create two pages: Test1 and Test2
 # On Test1, add the following text: "Link to a page"
 # Underneath that text, add a link in which the link text is "Link to a page" and the target is the Test2 page
 # Save the page
 # Highlight any of the words in the text (not link) "Link to a page" and add an inline comment

h3. Observed behaviour

I see the below error:
{code:java}
We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.
{code}
h3. Expected behaviour

The user should be able to add a comment.
fields.summary: Inline comment is broken if a page contains a link to another page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36408].
  {panel}

Same behavior that was Fixed in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28401 on version 5.5 but reoccurring in 5.6 confluence.

h3. Reproduce:
- create user with Full name *User One*
- @mention user in confluence
- change users Full Name to *anything else*
- try to @mention *anything else*

h3. Expected
users full name anything else will be found and mentioned

h3. Actual
user not found
BUT ...
- you can still @mention *User One*
- on save the @mention changes to *anything else*

Additional Note:
Content re-index does not clear this out

h3. Workaround
There are some elements of the user mention list that are cached browser-side. Clearing the browser cache may resolve this issue for individual users: https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-reset-the-user-mention-list-953658485.html
fields.summary: After user changes Full Name the @mention does not work correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36406].
  {panel}

When Confluence gives the *Use* permissions for anonymous in Confluence, it will let any anonymous edit or create content in the instance. However, when an anonymous is creating content or editing a page, the following message is presented:

!anonymous.png!

The reason for asking to modify this message would be regarding. Companies that allow only employees to have login in the instance. Otherwise, if the anonymous user is not aware about it, he could send messages to the administrator to ask for a login. Depending on the number of anonymous, it could need some extra work.

A good suggestion would be to remove the login link for anonymous user in that message.
fields.summary: Customise the Message for Anonymous with Access to Edit Pages

fields.description:
1. Edit a page in confluence
 2. Make sure Num Lock is on
 3. Press CTRL+F and quickly type in numbers from the NUM pad (ie, pretend you are searching for a number 1234)
 4. Notice that "1234" gets transposed to "abcd" in the Find box.
 5. Notice if you wait for the animated "Find in page" dropdown to complete before typing, the numbers will show up correctly. Also, this doesn't affect numbers typed into the number row on the keyboard, only affects the Number pad (numpad).

This isn't a problem with the browser's built-in find, it is a problem with the overridden find that appears when editing a page.

Tested in multiple browsers (Fiefox, Opera 28, IE 11)
fields.summary: Find in edit mode transposes typed numbers to letters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36401].
  {panel}

The Roadmap Planner is a great addition to Confluence, but lacks the ability to be resized or resize itself automatically based on content.  

Vertically, the lane labels are very short and cannot display something as simple as the word "General" without being cut off (with 2 lanes).

Horizontally, the bar text does not auto-shrink if the bar is too short to display the label.

Additionally, the editor view does not give you an accurate representation of what it will look like when you save the page.  There are 3 stages of how you will see the content, and they all are inconsistent (see attached screenshots)

1-In the actual macro editor
2-Once you click Insert on the macro editor, but before the page saved
3-Once you click Save and view the page as normal

I would suggest allowing the ability for this to be resized manually or have the label text auto-shrink to the size of the fields.
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner - Ability To Resize or Expand to Content/Preview Inconsistencies

fields.description:
h3. Issue summary

Confluence super user or "confluence-administrators" group cannot find restricted page via quick search but are able to access the page anyways with direct links.
 Quick search query will not return any restricted page unless the restricted page has been accessed by the super user at least once.
 * On newer version of Confluence (tested on Confluence 6.6 and Confluence 7.3.1), the page remains unsearchable even viewing the restricted page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a standard user under the group *confluence-users* (let's say User A).
 # Login as User A.
 # Create a public space or personal space.
 # Restrict view space permission to User A only.
 # Create a page and restrict view permission to User A only (optional).
 # Login as super user or user from the *confluence-administrators* group.
 # Search User A's content in *Quick Search*.
 # Observe the results.

h4. Expected Behaviour

Quick search should return restricted page due to the access rights as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF56/Site+Administrators+and+their+Permissions].
h4. Actual Behaviour

Quick search will only return restricted page when it has been accessed before.

• Before restricted page is accessed
 !before.png|thumbnail! !beforeaccess2.png|thumbnail!

• After restricted page is accessed
 !afteraccess1.png|thumbnail! !afteraccess2.png|thumbnail! 
 !after.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Confluence Super User Cannot Find Restricted Page via Quick Search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36389].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to replicate
- Follow the instruction in this link:
[Accessing the dashboard with a site homepage set|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+the+Site+Home+Page#ConfiguringtheSiteHomePage-Accessingthedashboardwithasitehomepageset]
_OR_
- Navigate to {{Confluence Admin >> Application Navigator}} and add an external URL (JIRA/Stash/etc)

h4. What's supposed to happen
The Application Navigator link is created

h4. What Actually Happens
No link is created and the following error is shown:
{quote} Sorry, something went wrong. Your changes are not being saved.
Try refreshing the page. If the problem persists, please contact your System Administrator.{quote}
In the log, the following error is thrown:
{noformat}

Try refreshing the page. If the problem persists, please contact your System Administrator.{quote}

h4. Workaround - Confluence Server only
# Stop Confluence
# Download {{commons-validator-1.40.jar}} from https://maven.atlassian.com/content/groups/public/commons-validator/commons-validator/1.4.0/commons-validator-1.4.0.jar
# Copy {{commons-validator-1.40.jar}} to {{<confluence_install>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib}}
# Start Confluence

h4. Cloud instance with Confluence & JIRA:
* Add the Link to the JIRA Application Navigator and it will be synced with Confluence in a few minutes.
* For Confluence only instances there is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Unable to Add URL in Application Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36388].
  {panel}

Hi 

We had some trouble regarding compatibility with Confluence  5.7 and our Theme add-on Enterprise Theme [1].

The main reasons where UI related with your new feature Inline Commenting.
Because of a different DOM in our Theme and the fact that you are adding the right padding directly to the #content element (without using a css class :( ), the Theme looked ugly, because in our theme the inline style has to be at another place. 

In the pre versions wasn't any event which we could listen on, so that we where not able to fix that layout issue. In the release version you added a set of new events, fired by Backbone, which gives us a chance to fix the layout - Thank you! 

But events are sometimes lazy and inline styles aren't such a good way - so I just like to ask you, if it's possible to change this implementation in using a css class on the body like "has-inline-comments-panel" or something else, where the padding is connected to. 

This will make the integration of the inline commenting more easy. 

Thank you 
Oliver Straesser

[1] https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.getunik.confluence.skin.core
fields.summary: Inline comments integration issue with Enterprise Theme

fields.description:
Was excited to use the new features of Confluence 5.7, especially the file viewing feature with ability to comment in context.

Everything seems to work fine until you try a larger file (multiple pages). I get a spinning wheel that never ends and it fails to load the file (I've even waited for over 12 hours, overnight, to make sure it wasn't the conversion that was taking too long). I know the file is fine because I can download it back and the thumbnail displayed on the confluence page shows fine.

Tried originally with a docx file, but even "bigger" pdf files don't seem to work either.

Attachment "Screenshot.png" shows what I keep seeing (spinning wheel) as well as a possible cause for the error (Ajax request seems to fail with HTTP 416 - Request Range Not Satisified).

My setup runs on a Windows Server, behind a proxy handled by IIS and the URL Rewrite module.

The following PDF file can be used to try and reproduce the problem:
http://conorlastowka.com/book/CitationNeededBook-Sample.pdf
fields.summary: Display of larger files fails with infinite spinning weel

fields.description:
h3. Summary of Bug

When a page is exported as PDF, special characters like Ω and µ are omitted.

h3. How to reproduce

# Create a page, and include special characters like Ω
# Save the page, and then 'Export as PDF'
# In the PDF file, the 'Ω' character is completely missing

h3. Findings

I have tried this in Confluence 4.0.3, 4.0, 3.5.9, 3.4.9, 3.3.3, 3.1.2 and 3.0.0_01. All of these versions suffer from the same problem. Have tried disabling and re-enabling the PDF Export plugin, then restart Confluence instance, but problem persists.

This is how it looks like in the editor :
!PDF export editor.png|thumbnail!

This is what happens after it is exported as PDF :
!PDF export result.png|thumbnail!

*Workaround*

Upload a font that contains these symbols to Confluence, as detailed in [CONF-25887|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-25887].
fields.summary: PDF export omits special characters like µ and Ω

fields.description:
If you change the application password in Crowd, then when you go to edit this password in Confluence, you are forced to click "Test Settings" before you can "Save and Test". After clicking "Test Settings", the value of the password is then reset in the form to the previous value, so if you immediately click "Save and Test" after "Test Settings", the old password will be saved again.

h4.Steps to Reproduce
Set up an application in Crowd
Connect Confluence to that application and check it's synchronising successfully
Change the application password for that application in Crowd
Disable and re-enable the directory in Confluence to immediately invalidate the session to Crowd
Force a sync and watch it fail
Edit the directory
Enter the new password and click "Test Settings"
After the test succeeds, click "Save and Test"
Observe that the sync still fails
Observe that the password value stored in cwd_directory_attribute table is still holding the old password
h4. Expected Results
The value should be held after clicking "Test Settings", so that then clicking "Save and Test" will work correctly.
h4. Actual Results
The value is lost, so the new password doesn't get saved
h4. Workaround
After clicking "Test Settings", enter the new password again into the form before clicking "Save and Test"
fields.summary: When editing an existing Crowd directory to change the application password, the application password value is reset to an old value after clicking "Test Settings"
